trails.summary: A great get away in the heart of the triangle with some scenic running down on Crabtree Creek.

trails.summary: This longer loop visits the three highest points in the park

trails.name: De Hart Botanical Gardens
trails.summary: An excellent way to enjoy nature and its wonders.

trails.name: Bond Park Lake Loop
trails.summary: An easy, short loop run around the lake on singletrack, mulched, and paved trail.

trails.name: Turkey Creek/Cedar Ridge Loop
trails.summary: A good rolling loop trail through established NC forest with water features.

trails.name: Horton Grove Nature Preserve Loop
trails.summary: This loop combines the varied terrain of several trails to make a great longer run.

trails.name: Korstian Foot Trail Loop
trails.summary: This loop combines several of Korstian's foot trails.

trails.name: MST: West Point to Pump Station
trails.summary: Take the Mountains-to-Sea Trail along the Eno River from West Point to the Pump Station and back.

trails.name: Umstead Loop
trails.summary: A scenic 12 mile loop around Umstead State Park (two ponds, steep hill section, and one stream crossing!)

trails.name: Lake Johnson - West Loop
trails.summary: A fun, urban trail with sections of singletrack and a wilderness feel.

trails.name: Lake Trail
trails.summary: The Lake Trail is a great urban escape and one of the best in the Triangle area!

trails.name: Durant Nature Park Loop
trails.summary: A rustic run that will remind you of summer camp.

trails.name: Battle Branch / Bolin Creek Loop
trails.summary: Wilderness in the heart of Chapel Hill adjacent to UNC Chapel Hill Campus, with plenty of hills.

trails.name: Jimmy Rogers Road Out-and-Back
trails.summary: A section of the MST along Falls Lake. The boardwalk by Little Lick Creek Bridge is the main highlight.

trails.name: Rolling View Marina View Out-and-Back
trails.summary: A pleasant section of the MST following the lake early on. The highlight is seeing Rolling View Marina coming into view.

trails.name: Falls Lake Trail - Section 1
trails.summary: Section 1 of the Falls Lake Trail leading from the dam at Falls of Neuse Road to Raven Ridge Road.

trails.name: Laurel Bluffs Trail (East)
trails.summary: The eastern section of the Laurel Bluffs Trail, leadring from the Pump Station to Guess Road.

trails.name: Highland Trail 1

trails.name: Sal's Branch Trail

trails.name: Raven Rock Loop Trail

trails.name: Sycamore Trail
trails.summary: An easy trail for running with minimal difficulty.

trails.name: Mountains-to-Sea Trail: Segment 10

trails.name: Cox Mountain Trail

trails.summary: This trail is the larger of two available at the Duke Forest and includes scenic surroundings.

trails.name: Holden Mill Trail
trails.summary: Pass the ruins of the Holden Mill and the rocky river bottoms of the Eno.

trails.name: Falls Lake Trail: Section 6
trails.summary: Section of Falls Lake Trail/Mountains-to-Sea Trail through Blue Jay Point County Park.

trails.name: Buffalo Creek Greenway
trails.summary: Very enjoyable trail—fantastic addition to Smithfield, NC with a historical marker of a bridge.

trails.name: Apex Community Park Trail
trails.summary: A relaxing and scenic trail around Apex Lake.

trails.name: Loblolly Trail
trails.summary: The Loblolly Trail leads from the Reedy Creek entrance to the park boundary.

trails.name: Eagle Spur Trail
trails.summary: An old rail line that runs through wetlands.
trails.conditionDetails: I just hiked to the end and back at dusk a few days ago. There is about 18-20 inches of water at the beginning but it's only knee deep. I think I counted 3 downed trees only 2 of those you have to bypass. and I did bypass where the culverts are being out in by trail volunteers. If you dont mind getting your shoes wet it's an easy walk to end where a small but nice view of the lake is. I would bet you could camp on that peninsula easily.

trails.name: Mingo Creek Trail
trails.summary: A great trail that borders a wetland.

trails.name: Crabtree Creek Trail
trails.summary: A paved path that is part of the Capital Area Greenway Trail System.
trails.conditionDetails: Muddy - Took the Neuse River Trail/ MST

trails.name: Laurel Bluff Trail (Central)
trails.summary: A rolling trail that follows the Eno River.

trails.name: Shelley Lake Trail
trails.summary: Part of the City of Raleigh Parks, this greenway path snakes around Shelley Lake.

trails.name: Black Creek Greenway
trails.summary: Another nature-filled trail of the Cary Trail System.

trails.name: Rocky Branch Trail
trails.summary: Wonderful trail going through southwestern Raleigh.

trails.name: Reedy Creek Trail

trails.name: Treyburn Greenway: Old Oxford Hwy Section
trails.summary: The continuation of the Teknika Parkway Greenway

trails.name: Leigh Farm Loop

trails.name: White Oak Greenway

trails.name: Mountain Laurel Loop

trails.name: Durham-Duncan Line
trails.summary: A trail along the old rail line.
trails.conditionDetails: Fallen Trees - I crossed a few down trees, I was able to move one off of the trail. Towards the end by the peninsula there is a very large tree blocking the path, reroute toward the trunk of the tree and you'll be fine.

trails.name: Forest Demonstration Trail
trails.summary: This trail offers an opportunity to see a forest in various stages of management and learn about forest management.

trails.name: House Creek Trail
